text: The only thing I ve learned this year is that I don t want to live anymore  For over   years I ve been lonely  and much of it I now understand  All of the pathological tendencies that my family created in me are self sabotaging  and it s even more disheartening now that I understand them  I now see how and why I am where I am  and I am ashamed   I hoped that I would be able to finally escape it this year with a new life in a new city with a new job  and I made the leap  but now I m alone  I hoped for chance to finally be able to find myself  the life I wanted  and love  but the pandemic swept that all away  Just with every other attempt to steer my future I get cast away by something I can t control  No friends  no release  just myself  alone  I m just a cog in the machine as all I have is work  but nothing to work for I just don t want to be anymore
summary: This year I have learned that I don't want to live anymore. For over years I have been lonely and I am ashamed. I hoped to escape it this year with a new life in a new city and a new job, but the pandemic swept that away.

text: I ve always thought of it was inevitable in a way  Seems to be creeping closer I quit a job in January because the schedule and and environment made me depressed  I thought to myself if that s all life is  it can t be worth doing  but at the same time the economy and my trouble with the job market to begin with made me feel like that crappy job was probably the best life was ever going to be for me  I m not special and life surely owes me nothing  I don t think that I deserve to exist in a way that would make me happy  I ve worked hard to try  but it doesn t work out  I have a meaningful degree from a meaningful university and I can t even get emails back on bank teller positions    Rejection is a specifically hard issue for me because my father  or the man I refer to as my father  rejected me my whole adolescence  I found out when I was   that I m very likely the product of a rape  which explained a lot of things  Still  hearing my dad say that he thought I was someone else s kid is something I ve never been able to get over  All I ve ever tried to do was to get his approval  I quit doing things I loved when I was young to do things he like  It s all I ve ever done  Sometimes I wonder who I am underneath this all  because all I am seems to be a series of failed attempts to win my father s love  I think about that moment every day  It s been over a decade and sometimes it s like I m still right there in the living room amp x B So when I get rejection emails and phone calls it s difficult  Dealing with the rejection of the world is getting harder and harder when I feel like I ve already given up as much as I can  I googled  cheapest way to commit suicide  today  It s hard to even get sad about it now  Life just feels done
summary: I quit a job in January because the schedule and environment made me depressed. I have a degree from a meaningful university and I can't even get emails back on bank teller positions. Rejection is a hard issue for me because my father rejected me my whole adolescence.
cleaned: quit job january schedule environment depressed degree meaningful university not email bank teller position rejection hard issue father reject adolescence

text: From someone who understands  be careful about what you  say When we are suicidal we tend to be at the brink with the  I have nothing to lose  mentality   You may call a crisis line or end up in the E R in a psych ward for   hours or a week  You may say things to the crisis worker that wouldn t tell anyone else  You see this is a serious problem because anyone that ends up in a ward gets a  label  more than likely  If you choose to live  which many of you will  you are still left with the consequences of the reporting your suicidal feelings   Most tragically it s usually young people in their late teens and early  s that get into the situation the most  You don t realize how much a stay in a psych ward or a diagnosis can affect your future career   I understand why you have suicidal feelings  life is getting harder and people can be the biggest back stabbers but please for the love of God  from someone who s been through this before do NOT get yourself admitted
summary: When people are suicidal they tend to be at the brink. They may call a crisis line or end up in the E R in a psych ward for hours or a week. Young people in their late teens and early teens get into the situation the most.
cleaned: people suicidal tend brink crisis line end psych ward hour week young people late teen early teen situation
